joint_involvement.justification: Based on the positive anti-CCP and RF, we can infer involvement of small joints.

serology.justification: Both RF (high-positive) and anti-CCP (positive) are high-positive per the guidelines.

acute_phase.justification: CRP is positive (56 mg/L), which indicates an abnormal CRP value.

duration.justification: No mention of duration or ongoing symptoms.

treatment_context.justification: Presence of methotrexate (a conventional synthetic DMARD) indicates established RA

classification_rationale: The patient has both high-positive RF and anti-CCP, combined with positive acute-phase reactant (CRP). The treatment context also supports the diagnosis of established rheumatoid arthritis.
